baseline_groups.claim_summary: Higher historical black lynching rates (per 10,000 black population using 1900 denominator) lead to lower contemporary black voter registration rates in Southern US counties.
baseline_groups.notes: Single baseline: OLS with state FE, historical controls (illiteracy, county formation year, newspapers, farm value, small farms, land inequality, free blacks), robust SEs. Coef=-0.469, SE=0.156, p=0.003. N=267 counties in AL, FL, GA, LA, NC, SC.

global_notes: Single clear baseline claim. 70 specs: 21 control variations, 11 sample restrictions, 13 functional form changes, 6 inference variations, 1 FE variation, 5 method variations, 3 placebos, 2 alt outcomes, 9 heterogeneity. Alt treatment denominators (1910/1920/1930 pop) and data sources (Stevenson) are core funcform tests. Heterogeneity (interactions + split samples) classified as non-core.
